actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with unmatched military strength, largest economy by GDP, dominant financial system (USD), technological leadership, and extensive diplomatic influence across all continents

sub_actors.name: Executive Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Core of executive power, includes POTUS and key advisory bodies like National Security Council. Sets national policy agenda, conducts foreign relations, serves as Commander in Chief of armed forces, and implements federal laws.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central bank that controls monetary policy, regulates banking system, maintains financial stability, and manages the world's primary reserve currency (USD). Crucial influence on global markets.

sub_actors.name: Department of Defense
sub_actors.description: Manages world's largest military force, oversees national security strategy, controls nuclear arsenal, and maintains global military presence. Largest federal department by budget.

sub_actors.name: Congress
sub_actors.description: Bicameral legislature (Senate and House) with exclusive power to pass federal laws, declare war, regulate commerce, and control federal budget. Primary check on executive power.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: World's largest population, second-largest economy, rising military power, dominant manufacturing base, growing technological capability, and increasing global diplomatic presence through Belt and Road Initiative

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: The ruling political party and ultimate power center in China, controlling all aspects of state governance, military, and policy direction through the Politburo Standing Committee and extensive party apparatus

sub_actors.name: State Council of the People's Republic of China
sub_actors.description: China's chief administrative authority and highest executive organ of state power, responsible for implementing national policies and managing day-to-day governance of the country

sub_actors.name: Central Military Commission (CMC)
sub_actors.description: Supreme military command organization controlling the People's Liberation Army (PLA), responsible for national defense policy and military strategy

sub_actors.name: People's Bank of China (PBOC)
sub_actors.description: China's central bank, controlling monetary policy, financial stability, and currency management, with significant influence over the world's second-largest economy

actors.name: Apple Inc.
actors.description: Most valuable public company globally, massive influence on global technology standards, consumer behavior, supply chains, and digital ecosystem with over 2 billion active devices worldwide

sub_actors.name: Executive Leadership Team
sub_actors.description: Highest decision-making body led by CEO Tim Cook, sets overall corporate strategy, product direction, and major organizational policies. Controls resource allocation and strategic initiatives across all divisions.

sub_actors.name: Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Corporate governance body providing oversight, approving major strategic decisions, and representing shareholder interests. Guides long-term company direction and executive accountability.

sub_actors.name: Product Development Division
sub_actors.description: Core technical and design organization responsible for Apple's product pipeline, innovation strategy, and technology standards. Led by key SVPs across hardware and software.

sub_actors.name: Operations and Supply Chain
sub_actors.description: Controls global manufacturing, logistics, and supplier relationships. Critical for product delivery, quality control, and maintaining Apple's production capabilities worldwide.

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Largest trading bloc, significant regulatory power ('Brussels Effect'), major diplomatic force, influential environmental policies, and world's third-largest economy as a collective

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch of the EU that proposes legislation, implements decisions, upholds treaties, and manages day-to-day business. Holds significant power in policy initiation and enforcement of EU regulations.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Controls EU monetary policy, manages the euro, and supervises banking systems across the Eurozone. Vital for economic stability and financial governance of the union.

sub_actors.name: European Parliament
sub_actors.description: Directly elected legislative body that passes EU laws, approves budgets, and provides democratic oversight. Key institution in EU decision-making and citizen representation.

sub_actors.name: Council of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Represents member states' governments, adopts EU laws, coordinates policies, and develops foreign/security policy. Essential for intergovernmental decision-making.
